intro: Zigadenus acutus, commonly known as the sharp-tailed lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Melanthiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Zigadenus acutus contains toxic alkaloids, making it potentially harmful to both humans and animals. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, adding a delicate floral display to its natural habitat.
